alert.note: Alert for Aiken; Edgefield; Lexington; Saluda (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 3:18PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Edgefield, west central Lexington, north central Aiken and south central Saluda Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 315 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ridge Spring, or 12 miles southwest of Batesburg-Leesville, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ridge Spring, Aiken Municipal Airport, Monetta and Hibernia. This includes Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 21 and 35. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Rainfall amounts of around 1 inch have already fallen with an additional inch of rain possible through 4 pm. Streams that will rise quickly will be Long Branch, Bridge Creek, Hall Branch, Mason Branch and Curry Branch. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
